intro: Anhaloniopsis, commonly known as the desert bell, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that come in a variety of colors, including red, orange, and yellow. Anhaloniopsis species are typically shrubs or small trees, adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. They have thick, fleshy leaves and produce milky sap, which is a common feature among members of the Apocynaceae family.
